com.andoverrobotics.core.drivetrain

Class MecanumDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.andoverrobotics.core.drivetrain.DriveTrain
      • com.andoverrobotics.core.drivetrain.StrafingDriveTrain
        • com.andoverrobotics.core.drivetrain.MecanumDrive

  • public class MecanumDrive
extends StrafingDriveTrain
    Implements the StrafingDriveTrain for a Mecanum drivetrain.

    See fromOctagonalMotors(DcMotor, DcMotor, DcMotor, DcMotor, OpMode, int, int) and fromCrossedMotors(DcMotor, DcMotor, DcMotor, DcMotor, OpMode, int, int) for instructions about easier construction.

      Constructs a new MecanumDrive instance with the given IMotors and encoder parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MecanumDrive

        public MecanumDrive(IMotor leftDiagonal,
                    IMotor rightDiagonal,
                    IMotor leftSide,
                    IMotor rightSide,
                    OpMode opMode,
                    int ticksPerInch,
                    int ticksPer360)
        Constructs a new MecanumDrive instance with the given IMotors and encoder parameters.
        Parameters:
        leftDiagonal - The IMotor that represents the two physical motors that make the robot go (forward and) to the left when the power is positive
        rightDiagonal - The IMotor that represents the two physical motors that make the robot go (forward and) to the right when the power is positive
        leftSide - The IMotor that represents the two physical motors that are on the left side of the robot
        rightSide - The IMotor that represents the two physical motors that are on the right side of the robot
        opMode - The main OpMode
        ticksPerInch - The number of encoder ticks required to cause a diagonal displacement of 1 inch for the robot
        ticksPer360 - The number of encoder ticks required to cause a full rotation for the robot, when this amount is applied to the left and right sides in opposite directions

    • Method Detail

      • fromOctagonalMotors

        public static MecanumDrive fromOctagonalMotors(DcMotor motorFL,
                                               DcMotor motorFR,
                                               DcMotor motorBL,
                                               DcMotor motorBR,
                                               OpMode opMode,
                                               int ticksPerInch,
                                               int ticksPer360)
        Constructs a new MecanumDrive instance that uses the given physical motors, which are arranged in an octagonal manner.

        The Octagonal Configuration

        In the octagonal configuration, the front left and the back right motors cause the robot to move forward and to the right (diagonally), and the other two motors cause the robot to move forward and to the left. It is named to be "octagonal" because of its diagram: 
           /-\
   | |
   \-/
        Parameters:
        motorFL - The motor located at the front-left of the robot
        motorFR - The motor located at the front-right of the robot
        motorBL - The motor located at the rear-left of the robot
        motorBR - The motor located at the rear-right of the robot
        opMode - The main OpMode
        ticksPerInch - The number of encoder ticks required to cause a diagonal displacement of 1 inch for the robot
        ticksPer360 - The number of encoder ticks required to cause a full rotation for the robot, when this amount is applied to the left and right sides in opposite directions
        Returns:
        The new MecanumDrive instance

      • fromCrossedMotors

        public static MecanumDrive fromCrossedMotors(DcMotor motorFL,
                                             DcMotor motorFR,
                                             DcMotor motorBL,
                                             DcMotor motorBR,
                                             OpMode opMode,
                                             int ticksPerInch,
                                             int ticksPer360)
        Constructs a new MecanumDrive instance that uses the given physical motors, which are arranged in a a crossed manner.

        The Crossed Configuration In the crossed configuration, the front left and the back right motors cause the robot to move forward and to the left (diagonally), and the other two motors cause the robot to move forward and to the right. It is named to be "octagonal" because of its diagram: 

           \-/
   | |
   /-\
        Parameters:
        motorFL - The motor located at the front-left of the robot
        motorFR - The motor located at the front-right of the robot
        motorBL - The motor located at the rear-left of the robot
        motorBR - The motor located at the rear-right of the robot
        opMode - The main OpMode
        ticksPerInch - The number of encoder ticks required to cause a diagonal displacement of 1 inch for the robot
        ticksPer360 - The number of encoder ticks required to cause a full rotation for the robot, when this amount is applied to the left and right sides in opposite directions
        Returns:
        The new MecanumDrive instance

      • setMovementAndRotation

        public void setMovementAndRotation(double movePower,
                                   double rotatePower)
        Description copied from class: DriveTrain
        Sets the power to move at and rotate at.
        Specified by:
        setMovementAndRotation in class DriveTrain
        Parameters:
        movePower - The power to move at, between -1 and 1, inclusive. Positive is forwards, negative is backwards
        rotatePower - The power to rotate at, between -1 and 1, inclusive. Positive is clockwise, negative is counterclockwise
